meanings.definition: To produce or provide a greater amount or quantity than something else.
meanings.sent1: The apple tree can outyield the pear tree in fruit production.
meanings.sent2: The new farming techniques helped the crops outyield last year's harvest.
meanings.sent3: The race between the two cars was amusing to watch as the faster car managed to outyield the slower one.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed allowed her to outyield all her competitors in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower outyielded the other flowers in the garden, standing tall and proud.

meanings.definition: To surpass in yield or output.
meanings.sent1: The new hybrid car design can outyield the older models in fuel efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The factory's new machinery helped them outyield their competitors in production.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's clever strategy to outyield the other squirrels in gathering nuts was quite amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity outyielded all expectations, leaving everyone in awe of her talent.
meanings.sent5: The champion athlete's performance outyielded all others, leaving the crowd cheering for more.
